subs.text: However: If I were to tell an unhappy client or vendor that I was no longer dealing with them, because they had violated the contract, but I refused to say how -- well, that would be problematic.
subs.rawText: However: If I were to tell an unhappy client or vendor that I was no longer dealing with them, because they had violated the contract, but I refused to say how -- well, that would be problematic.

subs.text: If I stopped hosting a client's web site because they had 'violated the contract' and then refused to tell them what piece of the contract they had violated -- well, I would imagine there would be consequences.
subs.rawText: If I stopped hosting a client's web site because they had 'violated the contract' and then refused to tell them what piece of the contract they had violated -- well, I would imagine there would be consequences.

subs.text: And if I told a judge that they violated terms with their content, which I had since deleted and had no record of -- well, that judge wouldn't have to deliberate very hard.
subs.rawText: And if I told a judge that they violated terms with their content, which I had since deleted and had no record of -- well, that judge wouldn't have to deliberate very hard.

subs.text: And if I told the judge that I had relied on an automated pornography monitoring program in decreeing the contract terminated and applied no personal judgement -- well, that might be seen as being irresponsible.
subs.rawText: And if I told the judge that I had relied on an automated pornography monitoring program in decreeing the contract terminated and applied no personal judgement -- well, that might be seen as being irresponsible.

subs.text:
2C:33-4.  Harassment.

...a person commits a petty disorderly persons offense if, with purpose to harass another, he:
subs.rawText:
2C:33-4.  Harassment.

...a person commits a petty disorderly persons offense if, with purpose to harass another, he:

subs.text: a. Makes, or causes to be made, a communication or communications anonymously or at extremely inconvenient hours, or in offensively coarse language, or any other manner likely to cause annoyance or alarm;
subs.rawText: a. Makes, or causes to be made, a communication or communications anonymously or at extremely inconvenient hours, or in offensively coarse language, or any other manner likely to cause annoyance or alarm;

subs.text: Fair to say that most of what talk about as harassment is indeed designed to cause annoyance and alarm.
subs.rawText: Fair to say that most of what talk about as harassment is indeed designed to cause annoyance and alarm.

subs.text:
So there is actually a reasonable overlap between Twitter's TOC and this criminal offense. 

So Twitter can legally continue to police hate speech (which uses words chosen to cause annoyance) and harassment. At least as far as New Jersey user is involved.
